meanings.def: a group or collection of things or people, often one that is large or impressive
examples: a vast array of bottles of different shapes and sizes
Her writing covers a wide array of topics.
It is difficult to choose from the huge array of wines on offer.
The city has the usual array of social problems.
The customer is faced with a formidable array of products.
The store offers a bewildering array of garden tools.
a seemingly endless array of options

meanings.def: a way of organizing and storing related data in a computer memory
a set of numbers, signs or values arranged in rows and columns
to arrange a group of things in an attractive way or so that they are in order
examples: be arrayed (+ adv./prep.) Jars of all shapes and sizes were arrayed on the shelves.

meanings.def: to arrange soldiers in a position from which they are ready to attack
examples: (be) arrayed (against somebody) (figurative) the hostile forces arrayed against them
